lines.text: life imprisonment. And so to the names of Madeleine Smith, Florence Maybrick, Lydia Trueblood, and all those other young, beautiful, but evil poison murderers was added that of Lynne Cameron.
It's one thing for us to believe someone's guilty, but it's quite another to prove it beyond a reasonable doubt.
That's a must for any conviction.
If we don't come up with new evidence, we're dead!
It all adds up, Mrs. Cameron. You were the only one with the motive and the opportunity of getting the poison to the child.
You think that I did this thing? That I killed Polly?
It's beginning to look that way, Mrs. Cameron.
But I loved the child as if she wee my own! I couldn't have done it!
Believe me, Mrs. Cameron, you'll be making it much easier on yourself if you just tell us the truth now.

[In voiceover narration]
I tried to pour the bottle, but my hand wouldn't move. It was if it belonged to someone else.
